content.question: In the <math alttext="x y"><semantics><mrow><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>-plane, the graph of a rational function <math alttext="f"><semantics><mi>f</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> has a vertical asymptote at <math alttext="x equals negative 5"><semantics><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. Which of the following could be an expression for <math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> ?

choices.label: ​<math alttext="fraction numerator open parentheses x minus 5 close parentheses open parentheses x plus 5 close parentheses over denominator 2 open parentheses x minus 5 close parentheses end fraction"><semantics><mfrac><mrow><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfenced><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfrac><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="fraction numerator open parentheses x minus 4 close parentheses open parentheses x plus 5 close parentheses over denominator open parentheses x minus 1 close parentheses open parentheses x plus 5 close parentheses end fraction"><semantics><mfrac><mrow><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfenced><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfrac><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="fraction numerator open parentheses x plus 1 close parentheses open parentheses x plus 5 close parentheses over denominator open parentheses x minus 5 close parentheses open parentheses x plus 2 close parentheses end fraction"><semantics><mfrac><mrow><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfenced><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfrac><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="fraction numerator open parentheses x minus 5 close parentheses open parentheses x minus 3 close parentheses over denominator open parentheses x minus 3 close parentheses open parentheses x plus 5 close parentheses end fraction"><semantics><mfrac><mrow><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfenced><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfenced><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfrac><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

content.answer: ​<math alttext="fraction numerator open parentheses x minus 5 close parentheses open parentheses x minus 3 close parentheses over denominator open parentheses x minus 3 close parentheses open parentheses x plus 5 close parentheses end fraction"><semantics><mfrac><mrow><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfenced><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfenced><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfrac><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Construct new functions, using transformations, compositions, inverses, or regressions, that may be useful in modeling contexts, criteria, or data, with and without technology.
